intro: Vismia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered vismia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and compound leaves with serrated edges. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Vismia minutiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats within rainforests.
